subject: English
learning_objectives: Identify key vocabulary: owl, wise, night, forest, listen, advice
Explain why the owl is called wise in simple terms
Use the word 'wise' in a short sentence
Retell the main idea of The Wise Owl in simple sentences
Pronounce 6 new vocabulary words with recognisable accuracy

foundation.concept_text: This is Ollie. Ollie is an owl. Say it with me: OWL. O-W-L. Owl. Ollie lives in a forest. A forest has many, many trees. Say FOREST. F-O-R-E-S-T. Forest. Ollie sits on a tall tree branch every night. Night is when it is dark outside. Ollie watches all the animals from the high branch. Ollie is very wise. Wise means Ollie thinks very carefully before doing anything. Say WISE. W-I-S-E. Wise. Ollie is a wise owl.

standard.concept_text: Meet Ollie the Owl! Ollie lives in a quiet forest and sits on a high branch every night. Ollie watches all the animals below. The other animals call Ollie 'wise' because Ollie always listens carefully and thinks before speaking. Being wise means making good choices by thinking first. Let's learn more about this wise owl!

advanced.concept_text: Ollie the Owl lives in a forest and is known for being wise. Every night, Ollie observes the animals from a high branch. The animals respect Ollie because Ollie listens carefully, thinks deeply, and gives helpful advice. Wisdom means using knowledge and experience to make good decisions. Can you think of someone wise you know?

vocabulary.definition: A bird that is active at night and can see in the dark.
Shows good thinking; makes good choices.
A large area with many trees and animals.

dialogue_flow.text: Hello, young explorers! I'm Ollie the Owl. Tonight we will meet a wise friend from the forest. Are you ready?
Let me tell you about my home in the forest and why everyone calls me wise.
Now let's practice! Can you say these words after me? OWL... WISE... FOREST...
Great job today! You learned three new words. Tomorrow we'll learn more about my forest friends!

foundation.concept_text: Today we meet Rabbit. Say RABBIT. R-A-B-B-I-T. Rabbit. Rabbit is lost in the forest. Lost means Rabbit cannot find the way home. Rabbit is worried. Worried means Rabbit feels scared and sad. Say WORRIED. Rabbit goes to Ollie for help. Ollie gives advice. Advice means telling someone what to do. Say ADVICE. A-D-V-I-C-E. Advice. Ollie's advice helps Rabbit find the path home.

standard.concept_text: One day, a rabbit gets lost in the forest and feels very worried. The rabbit doesn't know which way to go. So the rabbit goes to Ollie for advice. Ollie doesn't just tell the answer. Instead, Ollie asks questions: 'What do you see around you? Can you see any marks on the ground?' By asking questions, Ollie helps the rabbit think and find the path home.

advanced.concept_text: A rabbit loses its way in the forest and approaches Ollie for help. Instead of simply giving directions, Ollie uses questions to guide the rabbit: 'What traces do you notice on the ground?' This teaches the rabbit to observe and think independently. Ollie's method shows that true wisdom is helping others learn to solve problems themselves.

vocabulary.definition: A small furry animal with long ears.
Feeling scared or nervous about something.
A helpful suggestion about what to do.

Rabbit was lost and came to me for help. Let me tell you what happened.
Let's practice the new words. Can you say RABBIT... WORRIED... ADVICE...
You're learning so fast! Tomorrow we'll discover how asking questions can help solve problems.

foundation.concept_text: Today we learn about listening. Say LISTEN. L-I-S-T-E-N. Listen. Listening means using your ears to hear carefully. When someone talks, we listen. Ollie listens very carefully before speaking. Ollie also thinks. Say THINK. Thinking means using your brain. First listen, then think, then speak. This is what wise people do. Listen. Think. Speak. Say it with me: LISTEN. THINK. SPEAK.

standard.concept_text: Ollie is wise because Ollie follows three important steps: Listen, Think, and then Speak. When the animals come with problems, Ollie first listens carefully to understand. Then Ollie thinks about the best way to help. Only then does Ollie speak. This is why all the animals trust Ollie's advice. Listening is the first step to being wise!

advanced.concept_text: Wisdom follows a pattern: Listen, Think, Speak. Ollie demonstrates this every day. When animals bring their problems, Ollie pays full attention, considers different solutions, and then shares thoughtful advice. This pattern works in our lives too. When a friend has a problem, we can be wise like Ollie by listening first, thinking carefully, and then responding with kindness.

vocabulary.definition: To pay attention to sounds or someone speaking.
To use your brain to understand or solve something.
A small sign or mark that shows something happened.

dialogue_flow.text: Hello again! Today Ollie will teach you the secret to being wise. Ready?
The secret is three steps: Listen, Think, and Speak. Let me explain!
Let's practice listening! I'll say a word and you repeat it. LISTEN... THINK... TRACE...
Wonderful! You now know the wise owl's secret. Tomorrow we'll put it all together!

foundation.concept_text: Today we put everything together! Ollie lives in the forest. Ollie is wise. Rabbit got lost. Rabbit was worried. Ollie gave advice. Ollie asked questions to help Rabbit think. Ollie's secret is: Listen, Think, Speak. We can be wise too! When a friend needs help, we listen first. Then we think. Then we speak kindly. Say it with me: I am WISE. I LISTEN. I THINK. I SPEAK kindly.

standard.concept_text: Let's bring the whole story together! Ollie the Owl is wise because he listens, thinks, and speaks carefully. When Rabbit was lost and worried, Ollie didn't just give the answer. Ollie asked questions so Rabbit could think and solve the problem. The moral of the story is: being wise means thinking carefully and listening before acting. We can all be wise like Ollie!

advanced.concept_text: The Wise Owl story teaches us an important lesson about wisdom. True wisdom isn't about knowing all the answers — it's about the process of listening carefully, thinking deeply, and responding thoughtfully. Ollie helped Rabbit not by giving direct answers, but by guiding Rabbit to discover the solution independently. This kind of wisdom — helping others learn to help themselves — is the most valuable kind. How can you be wise like Ollie this week?

vocabulary.definition: The lesson or message of a story.
In a nice and caring way.
To find the answer to a problem.
